art_direction: Vintage photo realism with film grain, capturing a cold, ethereal atmosphere through muted colors and cinematic framing.

scenes.title: The Silent Umbilicus
scenes.text: The scavenger's vessel, the *Stray Dog*, latches onto the derelict research station *Ouroboros-7* with a percussive clang that echoes into an absolute void. Inside, Elara watches the docking collar seal. Beyond the viewport, the station is a tomb of metal and silence, adrift in the star-dusted abyss. An unnatural, pearlescent smoke, thick as spun mercury, clings to its superstructure, defying the vacuum—the first of many impossibilities.
scenes.image_prompt: A view from inside a cramped spaceship cockpit looking through a circular viewport at the docking ring of a massive, derelict space station. Strange, swirling white smoke clings to the station's exterior. At the bottom center of the frame are the gloved hands of the pilot on the controls. Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, wide cinematic perspective, movie-like framing, cold silver moonlight, ethereal glow, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain.

scenes.title: A Corridor of Frozen Moments
scenes.text: The station's interior is frigid, the air tasting of ozone and something older, like dust from a fallen star. The main corridor stretches forward, a metal throat choked with the same swirling, weightless smoke. Emergency lights cast long, distorted figures on the walls. To the left, a biohazard symbol marks the MedBay. To the right, a stenciled sign reads 'Primary Research Wing.' The silence here is not empty; it is patient, a thing with weight.
scenes.image_prompt: A long, dark space station corridor filled with swirling, ethereal smoke. Red emergency lights on the ceiling cast a muted glow. On the left wall, a sliding door is marked with a green biohazard symbol. On the right wall, another door has text that reads 'RESEARCH'. The floor is metallic grating. Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, wide cinematic perspective, movie-like framing, cold silver moonlight, ethereal glow, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain.

scenes.title: The Diagnostic Ghost
scenes.text: The MedBay door hisses open. Inside, medical supplies are strewn across the floor, and a diagnostic bed is overturned. A ghostly apparition flickers into existence near a shattered monitor—a crewmember in a medical uniform, their face a mask of silent, looping terror. They clutch their head and dissolve. On a nearby console, a data slate remains. It contains the last log of Dr. Hira, detailing a 'cognitive infection' spreading through the crew, of seeing 'impossible angles in their sleep.'
scenes.image_prompt: An abandoned medical bay on a space station, in disarray with overturned equipment. In the center of the room, a translucent, ghostly figure of a person in a uniform is clutching their head in agony. A data slate tablet is sitting on a console to the right, its screen glowing faintly. Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, wide cinematic perspective, movie-like framing, cold silver moonlight, ethereal glow, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain.

choices.text: Leave the MedBay and continue on.

scenes.title: The Shattered Vessel
scenes.text: The research wing is a scene of deliberate destruction. Papers and crystalline fragments litter the floor. At the center of the room is a massive, shattered containment pedestal of obsidian-like material, its inner surfaces etched with geometries that seem to wriggle at the edge of vision. Wires spark from its base. Tucked away on a workbench, Elara finds a strange device: a Resonance Harmonizer, a handheld tool with brass fittings and a quartz focusing lens. A note beside it reads: 'It doesn't repel. It *tunes*.'
scenes.image_prompt: A large, circular research lab on a space station. In the center, a massive, black crystalline containment device is shattered, with fragments scattered around it. On a metal workbench on the left, a complex brass and quartz scientific instrument sits next to a handwritten note. Swirling smoke fills the room. Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, wide cinematic perspective, movie-like framing, cold silver moonlight, ethereal glow, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain.

choices.text: Take the Resonance Harmonizer and move on.

scenes.title: The Warping Hall
scenes.text: Further into the station, the architecture itself begins to succumb to the unreality. A long causeway leading to the command bridge seems to stretch and contract with each glance. The otherworldly smoke is thicker here, and phantoms of the crew drift through it like motes of dust, their movements disjointed and surreal. A low, dissonant hum vibrates through the deck plating, a sound that feels like a question being asked of Elara's own cellular structure.
scenes.image_prompt: A long, enclosed metal causeway on a space station, where the walls and ceiling seem to bend and distort as if seen through a heat haze. Ethereal, ghostly figures of crewmembers drift aimlessly through thick, swirling smoke that fills the passage. The far end of the causeway glows with a faint light. Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, wide cinematic perspective, movie-like framing, cold silver moonlight, ethereal glow, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain.

choices.text: Rush through before the structure collapses.

scenes.title: An Unwritten End
scenes.text: In their haste, Elara fails to comprehend the corridor's true nature. It is not merely distorted space, but inconsistent time. They stumble, and their foot passes through the floor as if it were vapor. The dissonant hum intensifies into a roar, and the fabric of Elara's being is pulled apart, thread by thread. There is no pain, only a sudden, profound, and absolute cessation. They are not dead; they have been unwritten from reality's ledger.
scenes.image_prompt: A person's body dissolving into particles of light and smoke within a distorted space station corridor. Their form is halfway erased, blending into the swirling miasma around them as the metal walls warp into impossible shapes. Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, wide cinematic perspective, movie-like framing, cold silver moonlight, ethereal glow, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain.

scenes.title: The Chromatic Shard
scenes.text: The bridge is a frozen tableau of chaos. The vast forward viewscreen shows not stars, but a churning vortex of impossible colors. On the captain's console, a single, fist-sized shard of the Null-Lattice rests. It glows with an internal, sickly green light, and the air around it bends. A voice, clear and cold, echoes in Elara's mind, not through the air. 'Do not touch it,' it warns, a remnant of the station's chief scientist. 'It remembers its whole. It wants to be complete again. It will use you.'
scenes.image_prompt: The command bridge of a derelict spaceship. The main viewscreen at the front shows a swirling vortex of surreal colors. In the center of the frame, on a control console, sits a single, jagged crystalline shard glowing with an intense green light, distorting the air around it. Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, wide cinematic perspective, movie-like framing, cold silver moonlight, ethereal glow, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain.

choices.text: Heed the warning and leave the shard.
Take the cursed shard. Power is necessary.

scenes.title: A Symphony of Wrongness
scenes.text: As Elara's fingers close around the shard, a torrent of alien knowledge floods their mind—fractal geometries, alien histories, the cold logic of a cosmos that views life as a fleeting chemical impurity. The pain is immense, but it recedes, leaving a terrible clarity. The station's ghostly apparitions now turn to face Elara, their silent screams replaced with a look of reverent fear. The shard hums in their hand, a key to this warped kingdom. It pulls them toward the heart of the station: the Engine Room.
scenes.image_prompt: A first-person view of a hand holding a glowing green crystal shard. The world around is warped and distorted as if viewed through a fish-eye lens. In the distance, ghostly figures can be seen bowing down. The metal walls of the space station seem to be melting. Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, wide cinematic perspective, movie-like framing, cold silver moonlight, ethereal glow, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain.

choices.text: Follow the shard's pull to the Engine Room.

scenes.title: The Unaugmented Path
scenes.text: Elara steps back from the console, the psychic warning echoing in their mind. The shard's malevolent green glow seems to intensify, as if in anger. Without its power, the station's unreality presses in harder. Walls groan, and the floor shifts unpredictably. Elara clutches the Resonance Harmonizer, its steady, low hum a small anchor in the chaos. The path to the Engine Room, the source of the station's power and its current affliction, will be treacherous, a journey of pure will against a tide of cosmic entropy.
scenes.image_prompt: A lone figure stands in a dark space station corridor that is actively twisting and deforming. The person is holding a small, complex device that emits a steady, soft golden light, pushing back the encroaching shadows and smoke. In the background, a green glow emanates from the bridge they just left. Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, wide cinematic perspective, movie-like framing, cold silver moonlight, ethereal glow, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain.

choices.text: Navigate to the Engine Room with the Harmonizer.

scenes.title: The Corrupted Heart
scenes.text: The Engine Room is a cathedral of alien geometry. The station's core, once a miniature star, is now a black, silent sphere absorbing all light, caged by conduits that have twisted into organic, thorny shapes. The shard in Elara's hand pulses in time with the core's anti-rhythm. It offers a choice: to become a vessel, to merge with this nexus of power and impose a new order. Or to use its connection to force an overload, an act of annihilation that would cleanse this cosmic stain at the cost of everything.
scenes.image_prompt: A vast, cavernous engine room. In the center, a massive, perfectly black sphere of energy is suspended by thick, twisted cables that look like thorny vines. A lone figure stands on a gantry before it, holding a glowing green shard that pulses with dark light, casting their shadow long and distorted behind them. Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, wide cinematic perspective, movie-like framing, cold silver moonlight, ethereal glow, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain.

choices.text: Merge with the core. Become something more.
Force the core to overload. End it all.

scenes.title: The Resonant Solution
scenes.text: In the Engine Room, the Harmonizer comes alive. Through its lens, Elara can see the dissonant frequencies pouring from the contained singularity. The device reveals the patterns, the complex counter-melodies needed to either collapse the anomaly or shield a path through it. The station's core flickers violently, a dying star held in check. The entity is aware of them, its immense, unthinking pressure bearing down. Two paths are clear: banish the intruder, or carve a path to run.
scenes.image_prompt: A massive, brightly glowing but unstable energy core in a space station engine room. A person stands before it, looking through the lens of a brass and quartz device, which superimposes a complex waveform diagram over the scene. The air is clear of smoke here, pushed back by the device's hum. Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, wide cinematic perspective, movie-like framing, cold silver moonlight, ethereal glow, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain.

choices.text: Attempt to reverse the energy flow and banish the entity.
Use the Harmonizer to stabilize a path back to the ship.

scenes.title: The Closing Eye
scenes.text: Elara tunes the Harmonizer, not to fight, but to shield. A narrow corridor of stable reality forms before them, a tunnel through the madness. They run, the sounds of a collapsing universe at their back. Ghostly hands reach from the walls of the tunnel, and the structure of the station groans its final death agony. They burst back into the docking bay, slam the airlock controls, and jettison. Behind them, *Ouroboros-7* doesn't explode. It folds in on itself, winking out of existence as if it had never been. The silence that follows is absolute.
scenes.image_prompt: View from a spaceship cockpit, rapidly pulling away from a derelict space station. The station is visibly folding in on itself, being crushed into a single point of light by an unseen force. The stars in the background are distorted around it. Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, wide cinematic perspective, movie-like framing, cold silver moonlight, ethereal glow, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain.

scenes.title: The New Custodian
scenes.text: Elara holds the shard aloft and steps into the void of the core. The self they were is stripped away, a meaningless collection of memories and impulses. In its place, a new consciousness is born, ancient and vast, forged from human desperation and alien geometry. The station becomes its body, the swirling smoke its thoughts. It gazes out at the cosmos, no longer a scavenger, but a silent, patient god of a forgotten place, waiting for the next ship to wander into its domain.
scenes.image_prompt: A humanoid figure made of swirling cosmic dust and green energy stands where a space station's engine core once was. Its form is indistinct, with glowing points of light for eyes. The surrounding metal of the station is reforming into crystalline, organic patterns around it. Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, wide cinematic perspective, movie-like framing, cold silver moonlight, ethereal glow, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain.

scenes.title: A Point of Light
scenes.text: With a final act of will, Elara channels their own life force through the shard and into the core. It is the wrong key in the wrong lock, a paradox the entity cannot resolve. The core destabilizes, not into an explosion, but a perfect, silent implosion of light and energy. For a single moment, Elara sees the true shape of the universe, a beautiful and terrifying lattice of infinite dimensions. Then, they, the station, and the cosmic horror it housed are gone, reduced to a fading mote of resolving physics.
scenes.image_prompt: An impossibly bright, pure white light emanates from the center of a space station, vaporizing it from the inside out. The station's metal hull is peeling away like flower petals, dissolving into the glare. The background is the blackness of space, starkly contrasted by the final, cleansing light. Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, wide cinematic perspective, movie-like framing, cold silver moonlight, ethereal glow, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain.

scenes.title: The Silent Ward
scenes.text: Elara follows the Harmonizer's guidance, manipulating energy conduits and rerouting power in a sequence that feels more like a hymn than an engineering procedure. The dissonant hum of the station rises to a shriek, and the viewscreen on the bridge shows the vortex tearing open. With a final, violent shudder, the formless presence is expelled back into the nothing from which it came. The unnatural smoke evaporates. The ghosts fade. The station is inert, a silent, powerless shell. Elara is alive, and utterly alone in the now-harmless tomb.
scenes.image_prompt: A lone figure stands in the silent, now-still engine room of a space station. The central core is dark and powered down. All the strange smoke and apparitions are gone. A profound sense of emptiness and silence pervades the scene, lit only by the cold light of distant stars through a viewport. Vintage photo realism, film grain, authentic photography, wide cinematic perspective, movie-like framing, cold silver moonlight, ethereal glow, muted reds and greens, classic horror palette, subtle film grain.
